activityName: RWA Tokenization – Real Estate (Registry/RWA tokens/Utility, Non‑Security)
description: Digitizes property data and issues non‑security registry/RWA Tokens/utility tokens (digital twins) for provenance, encumbrance notes, workflow tracking, and audit trails; tokens do not constitute legal title.
Issues authenticity/ownership‑reference NFTs, RWA Tokens and registry tokens for artworks, collectibles, and luxury items (serials, provenance, custody chain). No investment or fractional rights.
Creates registry tokens mirroring warehouse receipts/inventory lots for supply‑chain tracking and reconciliation; tokens used for reference and workflow, not trading or investment.

activityName: RWA Tokenization – Precious Metals & Stones (Registry, Non‑Security)
description: Mints registry tokens referencing bars/gems (serial/assayer/cert numbers) for provenance and chain‑of‑custody tracking; tokens are not claims to metal/value.
Issues utility/registry/RWA tokens for farm‑to‑fork traceability (crop, batch, origin, quality, cold‑chain) and certifications; no trading or investment features.

activityName: RWA Tokenization – IP & Licensing  (Registry/RWA tokens/Utility, Non‑Security)
activityGroup: Patent / Royalties / Copyrights / Trademarks / Intellectual Property
description: Tokenizes IP records and license entitlements into RWA Tokens/utility/registry tokens for access control, attribution, and usage tracking; optional automated royalty routing via licensed PSPs.

activityGroup: Vehicles / Furniture / Yachts / Ships / Boats / Aircraft
description: Creates RWA Tokens/registry tokens referencing registered assets (VIN/IMO/Tail numbers) for maintenance logs, lien notes, and custody trail. Tokens are informational—no legal title transfer on‑chain.
Issues RWA Tokens/utility tokens/NFTs for software licenses, domain names, digital certificates, and access passes; for consumptive use and verification only.
Publishes project/impact data and retirement attestations on‑chain via RWA Tokens/utility/registry tokens; integrates with recognized registries; tokens are proof/records, not tradable instruments.

activityName: RWA Tokenization – Machinery & Equipment (Asset Passport, Non‑Security)
description: Mints asset‑passport tokens for serial‑numbered equipment covering ownership reference, maintenance, warranties, and transfer workflows.
Issues time‑bound RWA Tokens/utility tokens/NFTs as access or usage passes for leased assets/premises; supports entitlements and revocation; tokens do not replace statutory lease contracts.

activityName: RWA Tokenization – Music Rights  (Registry/RWA tokens/Utility, Non‑Security)
description: Tokenizes music license metadata (ISRC/ISWC/territory/term) for usage tracking and access control; optional automated payouts via licensed PSPs.
Creates RWA Tokens/utility/registry tokens referencing corporate records (licenses, certificates, resolutions) for compliance, data integrity, and workflow—not equity/shares.
Issues RWA Tokens/registry tokens for medical devices/pharma batches with UDI/lot/expiry and cold‑chain tracking for provenance and recall management.

Hosts a decentralized platform for biotech R&D collaboration and funding (researchers and contributors form DAOs to fund projects via tokens, not securities).

Offering decentralized education platforms or resources. Accreditation, quality assurance, and intellectual property might be the focus areas.

DAOs optimizing supply chain management, logistics, and traceability of goods. Legal aspects include trade regulations, product liability, and international trade laws.

A non-custodial wallet is a type of digital wallet where users have complete control over their private keys and assets. The non-custodial wallet solution license is a white label solution for “non-custodial wallet” only, where the non-custodial wallet can connect with the exchange with APIs. However, the non-custodial wallet should not provide any regulated services, including brokerage, platform operator, custody, exchange, management etc. Role should be limited to providing only non-custodial wallets which can be integrated into various regulated platforms. Wallets should have adequate security features and should be non-custodial in nature. Privacy token, algorithmic tokens and private chains should be excluded. The entity will not handle on & off ramping of Fiat
